### assignCalleeSavedSpillSlots() {#ace3b0eb52be3988997a7f6e4a5b59aab}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool PPCFrameLowering::assignCalleeSavedSpillSlots (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetregisterinfo">TargetRegisterInfo</a> &#42; TRI, std::vector&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/calleesavedinfo">CalleeSavedInfo</a> &gt; &amp; CSI) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
This function will assign callee saved gprs to volatile vector registers for prologue spills when applicable.

It returns false if there are any registers which were not spilled to volatile vector registers.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcframelowering-h/#l00127">127</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcframelowering-h">PPCFrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcframelowering-cpp/#l02330">2330</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcframelowering-cpp">PPCFrameLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### canUseAsEpilogue() {#a2c9566508140cc03db82c98053ef74be}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool PPCFrameLowering::canUseAsEpilogue (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &amp; MBB) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> whether or not the given <code>MBB</code> can be used as a epilogue for the target.

The epilogue will be inserted before the first terminator of that block. This method is used by the shrink-wrapping pass to decide if <code>MBB</code> will be correctly handled by the target. As soon as the target enable shrink-wrapping without overriding this method, we assume that each basic block is a valid epilogue.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcframelowering-h/#l00174">174</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcframelowering-h">PPCFrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcframelowering-cpp/#l00558">558</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcframelowering-cpp">PPCFrameLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</MemberDefinition>

### determineCalleeSaves() {#a88484d585ecc86920ebee6396946eae2}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void PPCFrameLowering::determineCalleeSaves (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bitvector">BitVector</a> &amp; SavedRegs, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/regscavenger">RegScavenger</a> &#42; RS=nullptr) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
This method determines which of the registers reported by <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetregisterinfo/#ad71b5bc0aa81f5dec06cbfecaf2f7183">TargetRegisterInfo::getCalleeSavedRegs()</a> should actually get saved.

The default implementation checks populates the <code>SavedRegs</code> bitset with all registers which are modified in the function, targets may override this function to save additional registers. This method also sets up the register scavenger ensuring there is a free register or a frameindex available. This method should not be called by any passes outside of PEI, because it may change state passed in by <code>MF</code> and <code>RS</code>. The preferred interface outside PEI is getCalleeSaves.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcframelowering-h/#l00113">113</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcframelowering-h">PPCFrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcframelowering-cpp/#l01970">1970</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcframelowering-cpp">PPCFrameLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### eliminateCallFramePseudoInstr() {#a63c498f1fcb62301a44ad58e2dc8e7fc}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>MachineBasicBlock::iterator PPCFrameLowering::eliminateCallFramePseudoInstr (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &amp; MBB, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#ae34c996b58df9b9ce6695a0c8b70c533">MachineBasicBlock::iterator</a> MI) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
This method is called during prolog/epilog code insertion to eliminate call frame setup and destroy pseudo instructions (but only if the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/target">Target</a> is using them).

It is responsible for eliminating these instructions, replacing them with concrete instructions. This method need only be implemented if using call frame setup/destroy pseudo instructions. Returns an iterator pointing to the instruction after the replaced one.

### getCalleeSavedSpillSlots() {#a83a821743cb2c878d23ca01bb9b6c0ba}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const PPCFrameLowering::SpillSlot &#42; PPCFrameLowering::getCalleeSavedSpillSlots (unsigned &amp; NumEntries) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
getCalleeSavedSpillSlots - This method returns a pointer to an array of pairs, that contains an entry for each callee saved register that must be spilled to a particular stack location if it is spilled.

Each entry in this array contains a &lt;register,offset&gt; pair, indicating the fixed offset from the incoming stack pointer that each register should be spilled at. If a register is not listed here, the code generator is allowed to spill it anywhere it chooses.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcframelowering-h/#l00167">167</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcframelowering-h">PPCFrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcframelowering-cpp/#l00093">93</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcframelowering-cpp">PPCFrameLowering.cpp</a>.

  labels = {["virtual"]}>
restoreCalleeSavedRegisters - Issues instruction(s) to restore all callee saved registers and returns true if it isn&#39;t possible / profitable to do so by issuing a series of load instructions via loadRegToStackSlot().

If it returns true, and any of the registers in CSI is not restored, it sets the corresponding Restored flag in CSI to false. Returns false otherwise.

### findScratchRegister() {#a047d552c2558a05e834ccd1bd0750b69}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool PPCFrameLowering::findScratchRegister (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &#42; MBB, bool UseAtEnd, bool TwoUniqueRegsRequired=false, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> &#42; SR1=nullptr, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> &#42; SR2=nullptr) const</>}>
Find register&#91;s&#93; that can be used in function prologue and epilogue.

Find register&#91;s&#93; that can be use as scratch register&#91;s&#93; in function prologue and epilogue to save various registers (Link <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a>, Base Pointer, etc.). Prefer R0/R12, if available. Otherwise choose whatever register&#91;s&#93; are available.

This method will return true if it is able to find enough unique scratch registers (1 or 2 depending on the requirement). If it is unable to find enough available registers in the block, it will return false and set any passed output parameter that corresponds to a required unique register to PPC::NoRegister.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="[in] MBB">The machine basic block to find an available register for</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="[in] UseAtEnd">Specify whether the scratch register will be used at the end of the basic block (i.e., will the scratch register kill a register defined in the basic block)</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="[in] TwoUniqueRegsRequired">Specify whether this basic block will require two unique scratch registers.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="[out] SR1">The scratch register to use</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="[out] SR2">The second scratch register. If this pointer is not null the function will attempt to set it to an available register regardless of whether there is a hard requirement for two unique scratch registers.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
true if the required number of registers was found. false if the required number of scratch register weren&#39;t available. If either output parameter refers to a required scratch register that isn&#39;t available, it will be set to an invalid value.
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcframelowering-h/#l00065">65</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcframelowering-h">PPCFrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcframelowering-cpp/#l00442">442</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcframelowering-cpp">PPCFrameLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
